column2: ENGLISH
column3: FRENCH

column2: A sufi merchant has arrived from Arabia. His ship is severely damaged and carries rare goods. His crew are divided weither it was sea monsters or the ocean trade winds that caused the damage.
column3: Le confucianisme est une religion diverse comportant quatre branches principales :

column2: The ship
Trade with the merchants
column3: Exchange avec les marchandes.

column2: You damned heathens aren't landing a foot.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Slay the infidel.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: The merchant trades with you, making a profit. He decides to stay in port until his ship is fixed
column3: Le confucianisme est une religion diverse comportant quatre branches principales :

column2: You're under my protection
column3: Exchange avec les marchandes.

column2: I can't promise your safety.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Set up a quarantine.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: A group of Buddhists line the streets and demand the departure of the sufi merchangs. They claim Islam is only going to bring trouble.:
Now, let's be fair here!
Expell the heathens
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I promised to protect them.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Slay the infidel!
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: A group of Hindu's have gathered and demand the departure of sufi merchangs. They claim Islam is only going to bring trouble.
Now, let's be fair here!
Expell the heathens
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I promised to protect them.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Slay the infidel!
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: An uneasy alliance of Hindus and Buddhists mob the streets and demand the departure of Islam. They cite many times Muslims have invaded other countries. They claim they can convert areas even if they are a minority. You address the sea of orange and red.:
Now, let's be fair here...
They are leaving tomorrow.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I promised to protect them.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I will only speak to one representative.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: It is claimed that one of the Muslim sailors slapped a child for eating pig. The peasants are growing restless as a consequence.
Where is the evidence?
Fine the Muslims
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: The Sufi are out!
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Mount a rigged investigation.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: It is claimed that two Hindus beat up one of the Muslim sailors for eating beef. The Muslim sailors are getting restless as a consequence.
Where is the evidence?
Give compensation.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: The Sufi are out!
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Mount a rigged investigation.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Jain merchants are encouraging merchants to not do business with the Muslims. They claim that Islam is a warlike religion. Muslims from the boat are surrounding Jainist stalls shouting "Allah is the most peaceful".
Bribe the Jain merchants.
Enforce religious neutrality.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: The Sufi are out!
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Jainism is peace to a fault.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: It is brought to your attention that several fabrics the Sufi's have sold in fact say "God is great" in Arabic.
Indeed.
OUT! OUT!.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I would love to find out more about this culture.
You are in the middle telling your steward to stop throwing pepper when an Arabic man walks in. He says his name is Muhammad and he is messenger of the one god. He wants you to submit.
Submit? You submit to me!
I will!.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I think not!
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Stop throwing pepper!
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Muhammad smiles and flies off into the distance.
What?
Muhammad welcomes you. He charges you to spread Islam to this distant corner of the world.
Of course I will!
Of course I will... secretly!
Never!
Muhammad tells your steward to stop throwing pepper. He does and changes his red turban for a white one.
I am convinced.
Muhammad tells your steward to stop throwing pepper. Your steward picks up the prophet and throws him down a well.
A Well?.
You wake up and realize it was all a dream. You look outside at the half cresent moon and laugh.
Crazy.
You wake up convinced you met Muhammad. You look outside at the half cresent moon and realize this is Allah's will.
I will submit.
I can't even remember his face...
The Sufi sailors are a true gift. They have shared new finds and created excitement in the province. A market has formed around the ship.
All is well, then.
Share secular items!
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Invite them to stay.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: The Sufi sailors have identified with the Hindu community. They identify with the Hindu belief to enjoy the present.
Miracle.
This never lasts
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: Invite them to stay.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: You recieve a message from the sufi captain. His ship is fixed and he is prepared to head back to Arabia. He promises he will return.
Safe travel!
I will invest in it.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: We can't forget your teachings.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: The Muslim captain visits you one sunset. You sup some Sop Buntut together and discuss your respective religions.
I appreciate it.
Islam isn't my cup of tea.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I will convert to Islam.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I will secretly convert to Islam.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: It has been reported that a crowd has broken into the sailors' homes and murdered the Muslims
What terrible news!.
Allah isn't that great...
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I need a share.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: It has been reported that your soldiers have broken into the sailors' homes and murdered the Muslims
Execute the soldiers.
Allah isn't that great...
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: I need a share.
column3: Dis-moi du Sufisme.

column2: It has been reported that after a fight between the Buddhists and Muslims the Sufi's have quietly slipped away in the night.
Not even a goodbye.
Local merchants are protesting after four of their daughters were seen on the Muslim boat. They returned home long past their curfew. Word is that one of the daughters intends to convert to Islam.
I don't care.
I hope they had fun.
Force the Muslims to marry.
Expell them.
Your soldiers fight a fierce battle with the crew of the boat. The crew one by one end up dead on the deck or in the sea. You walk onto the ship and inspect their cargo after the battle is done.
Allah isn't that great.
Your soldiers mass in what isn't a subtle operation. The captain of the boat suddenly steps forward and calls for a duel. You think about it.
Let me set an example. Get me my sword!
Swords are sharp and scary...
column27: Your soldiers fight a fierce combat with the crew of the boat. The crew one by one end on the deck or in the sea. You walk onboard and inspect their cargo.

column2: Your soldiers round up the Muslims and announce that they are to be expelled. Despite their protests that their ship is far from sea worthy, you order their ship back in the water, then crew back on the ship. Groups of cheering merchants gather as the Muslims reluctantly prepare to set sail.
I bet they'll sink!
We should help lighten the ship...
The Muslim ship, once prepared, sails at a good pace. It seems you undervalued their ingenunity, as it does not appear to be about to sink.
Good riddance!

The ship, once prepared, limps out. A small child next to you claims she spots leakage. It sails out the harbor and suddenly you see panic on deck. The crew try to turn around the ship but in vain. She sinks on one end and capsizes. Sailors jump from the side and swim. You swear you see ______ calmly gripping the rudder.
Kill anyone who makes it to shore.
Buy a new ship for the survivors.

The ship, once prepared, limps out. It follows the coastline for a while, but suddenly something goes wrong. The ship hits a sand bar, and the vessel's condition is such that it breaks apart. The sailors desperately swim towards the coastline.
Kill anyone who makes it to shore.
Buy a new ship for the survivors.

The ship appears to be in great condition as it follows the coastline. Suddenly, the ship is pushed towards the shoreline by a gust of wind. The crew desperately try to lower the sails, but the ship is pushed against a set of jagged rocks and is smashed to bits.
Kill anyone who makes it to shore.
Buy a new ship for the survivors.

Islam, the religion of the Western traders, has started taking root in this province. Conversion to Islam offers the peasants better prices with their 'Akki'. Islam is no longer a minority religion and will be the majority.
Invest in public works.
They are the movers and shakers.
I will slay them!.
You recieve a visit from the Muslim sailors who thank you for tolerating their stay. To show their gratification they present you with gifts.
Thank you.
I need a young lad.
Your lands are not so bright as the days of old and [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has the solution. You are to sleep with a Naga in order to comfort the gods and bring prosperity.
I will do it.
Oh but so slimy.

You are taught the pre-ritual by [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] and aren't doing a great job at memorizing. Is she really going to be a Naga? You pose and [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] laughs. "Of course sire, that is her identity".
Oh-uh.
The Naga

You are alone in your room and you hear an agressive hiss, your door opens and you see snakes clinging for their dear life on an advancing lady. She smiles at your discomfort as one climbs into her hair. She slowly takes her clothes off and you remind yourself you are a man. After a few false takes you complete the ceremony.

You are alone in your room and you hear the door creak. It is a thin beauty and you make your way feeling relieved. After culminating the ceremony you ask her, over a snack of fresh fruit, what exactly makes her a naga. "Well my people are called the Naga as you know, what did you think?".

You are alone in your room and you hear the door creak. Your eyes widen as a maiden is carried in, she wears an impossibly thin dress and is left on the divan. On approaching her you realize she was born with one leg, yet she doesn't look befuddled as you help her undress. You are impressed by her confidence as you bring good luck to your people.

Your head spins from the sheer amount of incense in the room, you climb onto the bed and turn around to feel a slithering on your belly. It is the Naga's scaley hands as she engulfs you. You wake up and your councilers are impressed that you performed the ceremony while asleep. You ask to see her but she left for Nagaland.
Ha, Never again.
It is said that your country has the most painfully spicy diet in the known world. You can't believe such arrogance so you decide to send samples by boat to the largest nations you can think of.
China ought to try.
The Calphate.
Lets test an Indian kingdom.
In fact maybe it's hunger speaking.
You are at the Emperor's palace when a ragged man enters. [From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent a Southern chef as tribute. He is to increase the variety of the Great Emperor's palate.
I will test it for poison
Not a good idea.

While at first you were on guard, you are enjoying the nut butter when presented with a red-colored dish. You hand the former to the Emperor and without thinking you dig in and feel your tongue is lounging on hot iron.
Water!

It is reported that your Indonesian chef has died on his return voyage. However the Chinese Emperor wrote a complimentary poem: Islander peoples need not torture with iron, why a spoon full of food will put the fire in.
That makes us the best!
Your expedition ships have returned and regret they have failed to convince [From.GetTitledFirstName]. The good news is they have sold the ingredients for a handsome profit.
All well that ends well.
A merchant has returned from the nutmeg isles with a chef who can cook the ingredients. This could be a once in a lifetime occasion to try Eastern cuisine.
He may serve
Not a good idea.
You are enjoying cold noodle soup when a red-colored dish is brought next. Ready to impress the court you dig in and feel like your tongue is tickling a scorpian.
Kufir!
Your Indonesian chef returns looking less plump. He had been jailed for fifty-six nights after making the Caliph lose taste in his tongue for a month. The Middle Easterners are stunned.
We are the most spicy!
Your expedition ships have returned and regret they have failed to convince [From.GetTitledFirstName]. The good news is they have sold the ingredients for a handsome profit.
All well that ends well.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent a chef to prepare their native dishes as a cultural exhibition. He says he wants to test what peoples retain the most spicy food. This should be interesting to say the least.
Fine, he risked his life coming here.
Not a good idea.

Your courtiers watch you chew your food with a concerned look. The first meal is simular in prickliness to villager curry, but you are losing the battle as the Chef grins with his pearly teeth. You struggle to complete the rest, but you do. Your visiter presents one final gift.
Not spicy at all!
Please! no more
Your Indonesian chef returns. "[From.GetTitledFirstName] says our food isn't spicy. That is why the next day he peeled all the skin from his tongue. They refuse to eat anymore".
With the spice we are nice
The Sailors have returned claiming India has us beat, which seems natural given the bountiful gifts we have recieved from them.
We are the most spicy in my heart
I refuse to believe
This means war!
Your expedition ships have returned and regret they have failed to convince [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Moreso nothing we had interested them, you frown as you promise to swallow the losses.
Drats.
You have decided to bridge relations with a neighbour by sending them bronze instruments.
I hope they like them!
You send them the gift of gamelan.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent you bronzen cymbals that resonate various tones, they seem otherly yet powerful in a musical way.
This is incredible.
Learn how to play them.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Melt them down to make statues.
Old fashioned, but cute.
You return to the sound of the Burmanese flute.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: They eagerly accept our gift and it is reported [From.GetTitledFirstName] spents many afternoons practicing the Bali style.
How did they live?
It is reported they melted them down to make statues for placement in a [From.GetHouseOfWorship].
Well it could've been worse
They prefer Burmanese music and claim Southern music is uncivilized.
Slaves to fashion
Your return time and time again to your gamelan set, the metal vibrations lull you to peace.
A private pleasure
You spend many an enchanted hour with the contraption
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: I should fund an essemble
You add a dash of sophistication to the royal court.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: There is one island where man doesn't live, or dare to, instead dragons roam. You hear, from a survivor, that twelve pearl divers visiting its shores were eaten.
I must possess a dragon.
Let that island be outside of human control.
After losing three men and a captain a dragon has been caught in an iron cage, it has been fed on cattle and buffalo.
Let it live in the cage.
Build a park for it, outside the city.
Build a park for it, outside the city. Spare no expense.
You are thinking of a suitable name for your dragon.
Watchful.
China.
Tricky.
Hmm ... more creative
You are thinking of a suitable name for your dragon.
Pepper.
Komodo.
Sunset.
Hmm ... more simple.
Watchful doesn't seem to like flying.
China doesn't seem to like flying.
Tricky doesn't seem to like flying.
Pepper doesn't seem to like flying.
Komodo doesn't seem to like flying.
Sunset doesn't seem to like flying.
You're a lame dragon!
At least he can't escape!
He is a swimming type.
He is a swimming and poison type.
Watchful can kill things by breathing on them.
When China breaths on animals they die!
Tricky spits death on passing animals. Such majesty!
Pepper's breath can literally kill animals.
Komodo seems to secrete poison as an extra weapon.
Sunset can kill animals by poison besides brute strength.
That's my boy.
But where is the fire?
Let's use the poison for our military.
Watching Watchful, high up in an observation post, you realize you've found your people's animal.
Watching China, in a protected area, you realize you've found your people's animal.
Watching Tricky you realize you've found your people's animal.
Watching Pepper, in a special enclosure, you realize you've found your people's animal.
Watching Komodo you realize you've found your people's animal.
Watching Sunset you realize you've found your peoples's animal.
We are the dragon.
I prefer the Buffalo.
This crippled dragon?
After some quiet months you recieve a Chinese embassay protesting your realm's animal figurehead. "China is the dragon" the vexed ambassador reports.
Who do you think you are?
We are so sorry. What tribute could rectify this?
How about we sell you the dragon?
The Chinese have backed down.
Curse them and their invisible dragons.
The Chinese have backed down and bring us the ambassador's salary to compensate.
All is forgiven.
Chinese mongrols!
____________ is offering a dragon for a pet. He will ship it from the South to the middle kingdom.
Yes, pay any price!
If it isn't bright yellow or red I'm not interested.
column3: Si il n'est pas jaune ou rouge je n'interest pas.

column2: Lecture the court.
column3: Donne une lecture

column2: You wait with the ambassador for a few months. It seems forever but you recieve a message from the Imperial capital. This whole ship is filled with gold for you.
Hurry!.
Chinese mongrols!
You wait with the ambassador for a few months. It seems forever but you recieve a message from the Imperial capital. No they don't want Watchful.
You wait with the ambassador for a few months. It seems forever but you recieve a message from the Imperial capital. No they don't want China.
You wait with the ambassador for a few months. It seems forever but you recieve a message from the Imperial capital. No they don't want Tricky.
You wait with the ambassador for a few months. It seems forever but you recieve a message from the Imperial capital. No they don't want Pepper.
You wait with the ambassador for a few months. It seems forever but you recieve a message from the Imperial capital. No they don't want Komodo.
You wait with the ambassador for a few months. It seems forever but you recieve a message from the Imperial capital. No they don't want Sunset.
We don't want you either.
Drats.
You hear that making a wish to a dragon can result in furfilment.
I want to become a great warlord.
I want to be a sage king.
I want to have many children.
I want to write a masterpiece.
Watchful seems lonely, you feel like you need to do something as he isn't acting like his gay self.
China just lies down like he is already dead..
Tricky seems to understand there are limitations to his movement and it makes him sad.
Pepper seems really grey lately. You need to do something
Komodo keeps looking past his enclosure in a look that betrays emotion.
Sunset is really down lately, you've thrown him toys and he doesn't even rip them to shreds anymore.
You're a lame dragon!
It's time to release him into the wild.
It's time to send my dragon back home.
Let's get him a dragoness.
4 soldiers have died in the acquisition of your new pet. There is distant rumble about crown excesses.
I deserve it.
I will compensate.
They are my pets too.
I want to write a masterpiece.
Your new pet is caught. But two watchmen have died from its poison, your marshal is ill from trying to suck the poison out of his friend's leg.
Give him a sum in case of the worst.
Physician!
Death is part of the profession.
Your new pet is caught. The marshal has a story to tell how they caught the lizard.
Superb.
If only you could catch other generals.
You couldn't wrestle a panda, what are you saying?
Your new pet seems to delight Watchful. They play fought for days and now are friendly.
China is enthralled with his new companion..
Tricky is still playfighting with his new friend. He seems to have less fight in him than his female counterpart
The new dragon excites Pepper who has tried to seduce her. The other dragon seems older than him and not interested.
Komodo and the new dragon are getting along like a house on fire.
Sunset is has abandoned his toys and is thankful for his new play thing.
You deserve it.
Maybe I should release them into the wild.
It's time to send my dragon back home.
Let's get him a dragoness.
Watchful is ill, he barely eats and his eyes are red.
China is ill, he barely eats and his eyes are red.
Tricky is ill, he barely eats and his eyes are red.
Pepper is ill, he barely eats and his eyes are red.
Komodo is ill, he barely eats and his eyes are red.
Sunset is ill, he barely eats and his eyes are red.
Send for the physician.
End his misery.
Maybe he is nurturing his inner fire.
The physician says your dragon is playing a trick. Soon he will pretend to die and turn invisible.
The physician mutters that your dragon has cancer and his time has come.
Your physician says due to constelational shifts, your pet has been viewed as sacreligious and they sent a plauge on it.
Your physician says Pepper is poisoned from his own spit and sadly there is little to be done.
Your physician says Komodo is depressed from captivity and is ashamed of his title of beast.
Your physician says your dragon has converted to Buddhism and is ashamed of his past deeds, hoping to reach a higher state next life.
I accept your judgement.
I will supervise you inspecting him.
I will release him.
Watchful has recovered and is catching up on all the buffalo he missed.
China is now a healthy dragon, His name should be Lucky
Tricky true to his name has convinced the grim reaper to look the other way. He is again your graceful, powerful mirror image of yourself.
Pepper has stopped coughing and now feasts on piglets and has learned his lesson to not eat decomposed carcasses.
Komodo seems to have recovered, he is simply laying there but turns up at meal time.
Sunset seems like a brand new serpant as he chomps cattle without fret.
Thank heavens!
After many fine years converting skeptics into belivers Watchful has passed into the dragon lands. Time indeed is a cruel master and you decide where Watchful should be buried.
After many fine years converting skeptics into belivers China has passed into the dragon lands. Time indeed is a cruel master and you decide where China should be buried.
After many fine years converting skeptics into belivers Tricky has passed into the dragon lands. Time indeed is a cruel master and you decide where Tricky should be buried.
After many fine years converting skeptics into belivers Pepper has passed into the dragon lands. Time indeed is a cruel master and you decide where Pepper should be buried.
After many fine years converting skeptics into belivers Komodo has passed into the dragon lands. Time indeed is a cruel master and you decide where Komodo should be buried.
After many fine years converting skeptics into belivers Sunset has passed into the dragon lands. Time indeed is a cruel master and you decide where Sunset should be buried.
Bury him on Dragon Island
Grant him a state funeral
Preserve him and place him near the fire.

[Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] reports that a group of potters that call him patron have been dabbling in Neo-Confucian beliefs. Despite their talents, their religious innovations are very dangerous.
It is of no consequence
Exile any contaminated village.
[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName] reports that a sorry group of refugees have arrived from China. Some are merely infants but others are master craftsmen, knowledgable in the latest arts.
Welcome!
We will take your leader as hostage.
You must drop your beliefs.
Good luck in your travels.

[Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName] reports that a sorry group of refugees have arrived by boat from China. Some are merely infants but others are master craftsmen, knowledgable in the latest arts.
Welcome!
We will take your leader as hostage.
You must drop your beliefs.
Good luck in your travels.

Our Chinese refugees have developed a sub-community that in the last 40 years has blossomed. The local community has identified themselves according to the successful, unique principles they have brought.
I see
Our Chinese refugees, through hard work have gained a stranglehold in the _________ market. The local community hates them but still cuts their hair at their shops and buy goods at their stalls.
This is dangerous.

You arrive one day to your council to see [Root.job_steward.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] shouting at each other. You ask them to explain themselves and [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] announces a white elephant has been located, daresay trapped.
I need to have it
I can't afford the animal
You hear a knock on your door, [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] creeps and after checking your blinds says a white elephant is available for purchase.
I need to have it
I can't afford the animal
[Root.job_marshal.GetFirstName] tells you that last night smugglers were caught. In their posession was a pinkish elephant.
These are very valuable.
I can't afford to take care of it ...
Sell it

Dear Excellent [Root.GetTitledFirstName], it is most interesting you have come to possess a white elephant as that is one of my pressing needs. As sovereign I need proof of my might in the flesh, not promise and this beast is a part of my plans. If you sell it to me I will pay 150 gold. Your faithful [From.GetTitledFirstName]
Write a favorable reply.
I'd rather keep it then.
Your [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] has news: [From.GetTitledFirstName] is selling a white elephant! If you buy it, surely it should be worth its weight in power.
These are very valuable.
I can't afford to take care of it ...
Out of all the people in the world, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to sell you their white elephant! such insolence!
That [GetFromRootInsult]!.

[Root.job_marshal.GetFirstName] has a bizzare story. A group of traveling entertainers were on the road when he spot them moving with an elephant. This elephant was painted in a black and white motif. On inspection the black paint washed off revealing an unregistered white elephant. The troupe scattered and your marshal arrived to the palace this morning, after a sleepless night.
I will keep this elephant.
I can't afford this beauty
Sell it
Despite your every measure you can't sell the beast. You've already hired a team to care for it.
I can't make a profit.
Your white elephant, which originally has died. You had not seen much of it lately.
Give it a lavish funeral.
Have a private funeral.
Its only an animal.
Sell the ivory from its tusks.
The funeral is cold and rainy. As a buddhist you know it will have a successful reincarnation.
An elephant never forgets, neither will we.

Your legs are like the valleys, your nose is sharp like the peaks, your arms the horizon ..., you are getting fed up of [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] constantly making allusions to your body.
I rather like it.
column3: Il s'aime.

column2: Can you stop?
column3: Arrestez s'il vous plait.

column2: Arg!
What of my nether regions?
Your rod is like the temples you have yet to build for the priesthood ....
No!
column3: Non!.

column2: I think I understand ...
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Your life-giving parts are like the resevoir you have yet to build for your people.
column3: Votre parts de vive est comme un resevoir, que vous voudrais construit pour vos gens.

column2: No!
column3: Non!

column2: I think I understand ...
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: When you asked [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] about what the Muslim merchanteer said, he replied he thought your realm was backward.
column3: Votre parts de vive est comme un resevoir, que vous voudrais construit pour vos gens.

column2: Well, that's rich.
column3: Non!

column2: He won't say that the next time!
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: He won't come here next time!
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: There is some slight grumbling about your palace walls in [Root.Location.GetName]. Traditionally [Root.GetTitle]s just leave a moat to keep accessiblity to their god-king.
column3: Votre parts de vive est comme un resevoir, que vous voudrais construit pour vos gens.

column2: Destroy the walls!
column3: Non!

column2: Breed moat water crocodiles.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: I don't care.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Explain how warfare has changed.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Because there are precious little horses native to the region, the stables has piled up debt in importing new horses.
column3: Votre parts de vive est comme un resevoir, que vous voudrais construit pour vos gens.

column2: Let the stables go into disrepair
column3: Non!

column2: Convert it into an elephant pen.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Pay to keep.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You are dragged from your cell in the pit and escorted outside. The light blinds you as you approach the bridge, are you free? You gaze and see a crowd of people, not your sort. Two guards announce that you have been deemed a traitor in the [From.GetTitle]'s eyes. You are then grabbed, arms, legs and head and thrown from the parapet ... into the river ... to the royal crocodiles.

column2: Monsters!

column2: Announce your presence!
column3: Zut!

column2: You greet the astounded group. You invent a false name, but you suspect they are as claimed: a band of monks who maintain temples in disrepair. They show you statues of Shiva and the prior damages of thieves. You exit through a more conventional gateway, but then hear screams in the undergrowth.

column2: You charge into the bush and slay an unsuspecting brigard, there are two score left ... who are your guards who stalked the stalkers who waited for the temple-devout to resurface. The miserable band lie dead on the floor. The holy maisons thank you profoundly and vow to praise the name Vivek the Riverman for eternity.
Actually I am [Root.Title]
After an improvised bow,They leave chanting your name.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: I do it for Shiva
Your men inevitably spread your legend in the bars of [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName].
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You run and hear their cries behind you, torn by the rock formations. You hit a dead end and look behind you to see your bloody guards followed by the temple's people. The battle is finished, the abushing graverobbers were slain.
Good thing I ran! [Root.Title]
Somehow the story becomes publicly known, although it is considered unbelievable ...
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: I was leading the retreat
You are praised for your tactical retreat of the unarmed men.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You creep down from the rock formation and one of the bunch scream, "It's a phantom." You try to show you are of the flesh but they think twice and run throwing their material possessions on the temple floor. After waiting a period, you figure your chalky clothes and bruises too seem ghastly.
Take their valuables.
You follow the trail of goods, then meet your quizing guards after darkness.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You try not to startle the group when they turn around armed, "This is your last day," one huffs and lunges towards you. You dodge the thrust and push him off a cliff. His comrades slowly encircle you and their leader, with icy eyes asks "Why shouldn't we just slit your throat?".
I'm a [Root.Title]!
You pull out a royal talismen.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: I'm my mother's only son!
You hope your appeal moves their rocky hearts.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Two weeks later, in the back of hay cart you reach [prisoner_buyer.GetTitledFullName]'s holdings where you'll be held until you cough up a ransom.
At least I'm not dead
The group has a great laugh, but then the leader closes his fist and indicates a slitting motion. The band falls on you and you are overwhelmed like a lamb fighting off starving dogs.
No! Stop!

The group has a great laugh and the leader offers you a place in his group of thieves, to replace Tanvi who you finished off. The glinted eyed gang-leader shows you the spot Tanvi landed and asks you say a prayer. You do and he kicks you off into space.
Arggg!

The group has a great laugh and the gang-leader offers you a role as their dog. If you crawl through to the enterance correctly they will let you live. You view your options then woof to confirm, crawling through all their legs. Your garments are now ripped but you crawl energetically on, hearing their jeers as they recalled Tanvi's best exploits. "O.K. downward dog, which way left or right?" You recieve a kick in the behind.
Left.
You crawl leftwards.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Right.
You crawl rightwards.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Where are you going? One gangmember poses and lifts you up, slitting your throat.
Chortle.
You choke on the red foam erupting as you snap to blackness.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Smart dog! they compliment as you make your way to increasing lightness, your masters' moods' are also light as they discuss their ill gotten gains. After passing through a statued exit you return to the jungle. "Woh boy slo-", advises the leader before being cut down by your guards. Your heart jumps out your throat as they reverse the situation with six remaining thieves.
Kill them all.
The crooks are summarily executed.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Bring them to my palace.

column2: Smart dog! you underhear as you crawl to increasing lightness, your masters' moods' are also light as they discuss their ill gotten gains. You run for your life, but are chased down and slaughtered.

column2: You run for your life and hide in the sharp bushes.

Whew
Your life returns to normality.

column2: You wake up feeling strained, you feel life come back to your limbs and praise [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] for your miraculous fall. Beside you is Tanvi, in front of you is a temple ramsacked. You look around and suddenly see a faint drawer, you open it with your fingernails and inside is a Danda.
Take it.
You return enrichened.

You return to your waiting guards with their belongings.
You tell a tale where you fought off two scores.

You speak to the girl.

After locating your guards, you tell them it is your will to enrich her to minor-nobility. She thanks you profoundly.

[Root.job_chancellor.GetBestName], face red, interupts and explains our pottery is imported to give the appearance of a civilized state.
Encourage native pottery.

Ignore the [GetFromRootInsult]

Persuade [FROMFROM.GetBestName]
Settle the issue cleanly with the [FROMFROM.GetTitle].

column2: [FROM.GetTitledName] after bowing for some period rises and informs you China would be willing to forget this incident, in exchange you journey and kow-tow to China.

Peaceful relations return to the two kingdoms.

[From.GetTitledName] returns to China.

Seaports are built by Chinese engineers, opening your realm to diversified trade.

column2: Decline.
[From.GetTitledName] returns to China.

column2: Decline.

column2: [FROM.GetTitledName] after a long proceedings, you have hammered out an agreement and balance is restored in Asia.
I must tell the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle].
You spend the evening writing a missive.

column2: Most High Exulted [Root.GetBestName], I have conveyed your wisdom to the savages of in the southern kingdom. They, now, will not challenge our dominant trade, which cosmologically and naturally flows like the waters under the Grand Canal.
All is good.
You close the issue.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: I will reward [From.GetBestName].
You inform the treasurer to give a reward.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Loyal Servant [Root.GetBestName], what you have done will be writen objectively as a great feat in the annals. They have already written that I rewarded the [GetRootFromCompliment] [Root.GetHerHis] weight in jade.
OK.

Thank you for your missive [Root.GetBestName], I pray your journey back is untroublesome. I have commissioned a gift for your return. The truth is as the [GetRootFromCompliment] Sun Tzu tells: "Supreme excellence consists in breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting."
OK.

You are sailing back to China, while your crew, above, thank [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] for a return to civilized food, you carefully write a missive that that the barbarian [From.GetTitle] rejected your overtures for peace."
Difficult journeys have suffering.
You wonder if your shakey writing is from the rocking of the ship, or dread of war.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Most High Exulted [Root.GetBestName], I have conveyed your wisdom to the savages who bow to [FROMFROM.GetTitledName]. They, sadly, rebuke our calm winds of peace and scold us, wishing to only bring calamity to their "civilization".
Hmmm, should I get revenge?.
Give [From.GetBestName] a gift.

Dearest [Root.GetBestName], what you have done, despite failing to stem discord, I still value as service to the state. When we are both elder statesmen we will laugh about this incident. May we live a thousand years!
OK.
Your treasurer announces you've recieved crates of gold and silver.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Hail [Root.GetBestName], while what happened generations may scorn, I believe you are an honest servant and will learn from your mistakes in service of your [From.GetTitle]. It is because of this I've gifted ten years worth of ginseng.
OK.
You begin adding the powder to your tea.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: What if it is poison?.
Surely the Emperor doesn't want me to commit suicide?
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

Arrest him.
[vassal_who_hates.GetTitledName] is thrown to the dungeons.

column2: Jail him but ...

column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: After a mixture of threat and bribe you have discovered [FROMFROM.GetTitledName] was behind the poisoning of his countryman.
I'll keep him in jail.
It is expedient to keep troublemakers locked up.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Free him.
Leave him to his devices.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Free him and hatch a plan.
He will interupt the ceremony and outfox the Chinese.

column2: After interviewing merchants, the archery houses and even the transvestites your spies regret nothing is suspicious. [vassal_who_hates.GetBestName] meanwhile, thrashes in his cage swearing profusely.
Ah good.
Your mind is at ease.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Your spymaster [Root.job_spymaster.GetBestName] quietly opens the door. [Root.job_spymaster.GetSheHe] whispers that he sent spies to the Chinese fleet but they were caught.
Oh no!.
The Chinese are infuriated.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: I can't accept such failure.
With friends like these who needs enemies?.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Seeing that you were in the capital, you decide to practice your Chinese with a Han Diplomat. It was to everyone's shock when his friend dropped dead. In hours you found yourself behind bars, this must be [liege.GetBestName]'s doing!
Arg!

Seeing that you were in the capital, you decide to practice your Chinese with a Han Diplomat. It was to everyone's shock when his friend dropped dead, during a feast. In hours you found yourself behind bars. You lose track of time and only are awaken from half-sleep by [liege.GetBestName] himself! Apparently it was the Chinese Envoy himself doing the poisoning.
Confront him.
Time to go homewards.

Seeing that you were in the capital, you decide to practice your Chinese with a Han Diplomat. It was to everyone's shock when his friend dropped dead. In hours you found yourself behind bars. Fine.

[sediplomat.GetTitledName] comes to your palace mounted on a fine steed. You ask why they seem jumpy, as no-one is to carry weapons by the palace, they reply one of their number has been poisoned. You confirm the rumour the [vassal_who_hates.GetTitle] has been imprisoned. They demand you put him to death.
Accept the demands.
You promise to execute [vassal_who_hates.GetBestName] in ten days.

column2: [sediplomat_envoy.GetTitledName] marches up to your palace steps and accuses everyone to be in connivance with slaying his staff member. Seeing that you have freed the assassin, they demand the [GetFullBaseName] become a tributary of China, or face devestating war.
Accept the demands.

column2: Deny them.
Risk conflict with China.

Jail him.

column2: Allow the Chinese to arrest him.

column2: In order to create an incident you poison a junior staff member, framing a vassal of [FROM.GetTitledName]. You thought the plan worked perfectly, Zhou dying during a feast. What you didn't figure would happen is the vassal would be freed. He near tortured you to death in plain sight of his monarch. To make matters worse your compatriots discovered the poison in your cabin and demand to jail you for your crimes.
I was only serving the Emperor!.

In order to create an incident you poison a junior staff member, framing a vassal of [FROM.GetTitledName]. You thought the plan worked perfectly, Zhou dying during a feast. What you didn't figure would happen is the vassal would be freed. He near tortured you to death in plain sight of his monarch. To make matters worse your compatriots discovered the poison in your cabin. With mixed feelings they let you be dragged to the cells and sail home to China.
Let me go!.
You are tied up and brought homewards.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: In order to create an incident you poison a junior staff member, framing a vassal of [FROM.GetTitledName]. The plan worked perfectly, with the coy of a concubine you get the ruler to give you whatever you want. You sail home, although you hear mutterings of the crew.
I was only serving the Emperor!.

In order to create an incident you poison a junior staff member, framing a vassal of [FROM.GetTitledName]. The first half of the plan worked like the charm of a Wu, the second faltered as the vassal was arrested. After your theatrical display that drove [FROM.GetBestName] to tears, you have secured concessions.
I was only serving the Emperor!
You dodge looks from the cabin crew as you picture your rewards on the creeking softwood.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: In order to create an incident you poison a junior staff member, framing a vassal of [FROM.GetTitledName]. To your strategic displeasure while you poisoned your adjutant with no problem, you didn't count on the barbarians arresting the "criminal". After your theatrical display that made [FROM.GetBestName] shudder, you have forced them to become a tributary state.
I was only serving the Emperor!
You write a missive to the Emperor over sachets of local alcohol.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Your minister [FROM.GetTitledName] has been arrested by [FROMFROM.GetTitledName] for hideous crimes. His party has privately confessed that he did poison a fellow subject to blackmail the [FROMFROM.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective]. He is locked in a cell in [FROMFROM.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName].
Leave him there for now.
You consider this issue closed.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Offer to drop the issue.
You will lift the embargo if he is freed.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Your minister [FROM.GetTitledName] has landed in Guangzhou and has been detained until further notice. His party has declares [FROM.GetSheHe] poisoned a crewmember to blackmail the [FROMFROM.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective].
Leave him there for now.
Let him think of what he's done.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Lift the embargo.
You will lift the embargo as a token.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] announces that a [FROM.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] envoy has offered to drop the embargo in exchange for the locked minister.
OK.
You trade the minister's freedom for economic freedom.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: He can bail himself.
You send the envoy back without his prize.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: He's dead.
You assure the envoy [FROM.GetTitledName] has no need for his servant.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] announces that [FROM.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName] has lifted the blockade of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName]. In the heightened atmosphere in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] you are proclaimed one of the greatest [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]s.
That I am.
Enjoy the praise.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: I just got lucky.
You return to statesmanship.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Your attempt to bribe a council member to side with you has failed. Nobody seems interested in betraying their lieges trust.
Drats.
You scramble to make a plan B.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You have decided, after noting this land is fairly decentralized compared to China, to bribe the council.
Let's get started.
You send servants to arrange meetings.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: While walking to witness a turtle race you note a foreign servant hailing from [FROM.GetBestName]. He asks for an audience in the "archery range" many nobles visit for hitting the spot. You divert your journey and make his acquaintance. He suggests that the latest trade reforms by [liege.GetTitledName] have shaken the cosmic order of things, and would lead to unbalanced relations between the ruler and his nobles.
I'm all ears.
You agree to destablize your lord.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Only if I get a reward ...
China will gift you in a myriad of manners.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: These talks must stop.
Stand by your liege.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You have gathered numerous powerful vassals to your side. They will represent you at a council meeting tomorrow.
Perfect.
You will wait patiently for the results of the meeting.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: During a council session you discuss giving no quarter to the Chinese Imperialists when loud cries of dispair errupt from the nobles. "Why go to war over pots and pans?" cries a new member.
I will follow your counsel.
You will avoid risking offending the Son of Heaven.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: There is a traitor afoot!
You decide to hold an investigation. This could prove very unpopular.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Diplomatically explain
Explain why a new trade commodity is worthwhile boon.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Silence!
Explain how the council is only a formality to stamp your law.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You wait outside the palace with your mission and [chinesekhmer_collaborator.GetBestName] walks out, moments later a servant approaches you and hands a scroll you have a freedom to ask what you wish.
Confront him.
Time to go homewards.

Seeing that you were in the capital, you decide to practice your Chinese with the Head Envoy. It was to everyone's shock when his friend dropped dead. In hours you found yourself behind bars. You lose track of time and only are awaken from half-sleep by [liege.GetBestName] himself! Apparently it was the Chinese Envoy who poisoned. [liege.GetFirstName] whispers [liege.GetHisHer] plan
Fine.

[chinese_poison_envoy.GetTitledName] marches up to your palace steps and accuses everyone to be in connivance with killing his staff member. Seeing that you have freed the assassin, they demand the [GetFullBaseName] become a tributary of China, or face devestating war.
Accept the demands.
You agree to become a tributary.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Deny them.
Risk conflict with China.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Execute him.
Guarantee warfare.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Call for [vassal_who_hates.GetTitledName].
Call [vassal_who_hates.GetTitledName] up to clear the air.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: [vassal_who_hates.GetTitledName] steps forward and orders his spearmen to aim at the diplomatic party. [vassal_who_hates.GetSheHe] points his sword at [chinese_poison_envoy.GetTitledName]'s throat and forces a confession that he poisoned his staff-member to gain leverage. The Chinese crew make an investigation of his cabin and discover poison.
Jail him.
He is detained in your country.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Allow the Chinese to arrest him.
He is tied up and will be judged by his ruler.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: In order to create an incident you poison a junior staff member, framing a vassal of [FROM.GetTitledName]. You thought the plan worked perfectly, Zhou dying during a feast. What you didn't figure would happen is the vassal would be freed. He near tortured you to death in plain sight of his monarch. To make matters worse your compatriots discovered the poison in your cabin and demand to jail you for your crimes.
I was only serving the Emperor!.

In order to create an incident you poison a junior staff member, framing a vassal of [FROM.GetTitledName]. You thought the plan worked perfectly, Zhou dying during a feast. What you didn't figure would happen is the vassal would be freed. He near tortured you to death in plain sight of his monarch. To make matters worse your compatriots discovered the poison in your cabin. With mixed feelings they let you be dragged to the cells and sail home to China.
Let me go!.
It is expedient to keep troublemakers locked up.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Free him.
Leave him to his devices.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Free him and hatch a plan.
He will interupt the ceremony and outfox the Chinese.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.
